title: 15 Stylish Sandals From Amazon That Are a Steal - All Under $50
description: Sandals and summer go hand-in-hand, just like ice cream and beach days, or, since we're talking fashion, flowy dresses and bikinis. But buying new ones yearly - or even replacing worn-out pairs - can get expensive. We know you already know that, which is probably why you're here, checking out our guide to the best sandals and summer shoes Amazon has to offer. The retailer is one of our favorite places to find shoes of all kinds (including heels, sneakers, and even designer shoes) when we're in a pinch and need that two-day shipping or when we want to cut back on spending and get savvy. Ahead, we've rounded up the 15 best pairs of sandals from Amazon for summer. We scoured the brand's bestselling sandals page to find the ones that will serve you best, from strappy sandals and braided styles to waterproof pillow slides and a block-heeled option for those who like a little extra height. We included a range of prices, too, starting at $14. Keep scrolling to shop our selects.
author: Marisa Petrarca

title: 22 Abercrombie Fashion Picks For Summer - With Sale Finds as Low as $20
description: Who would have thought that our closets would be filled with Abercrombie & Fitch again?! Abercrombie has long been famous for its expansive collection of TikTok-approved jeans, which are editor-loved. But recently, the retailer went through a little makeover of its own; long gone are the days of logo-filled graphic T-shirts and limited denim offerings, now the brand is a haven for all types of fashion-lovers - and sizes. It's the best place to shop for everything from stylish, elevated basics to vintage-inspired looks, seasonal trends, and even wedding guest dresses. The brand is clearly back and better than ever, and if TikTok hasn't already convinced you to shop at Abercrombie, let us do that for you. From trendy tops and elevated dresses to comfortable, tailored bottoms, Abercrombie has become synonymous with effortlessly chic clothing. Plus, if something doesn't fit quite right, or the color you've been eyeing is finally back in stock, the brand makes it convenient to file a return or exchange. We love browsing the site for the brand's newest arrivals and even scoring a deal or two on a few pieces. So we rounded up our current favorite wardrobe essentials and dresses from Abercrombie, so you know what's worth buying. Plus, for a limited time, you can get up to 50% off women and men's clothing, and an extra 15% off when you add to cart. Keep reading to shop our top picks from Abercrombie & Fitch.
author: Anvita Reddy

title: 20 Woven Basket & Straw Bags For Every Summer Plan
description: As you dress up for all your al fresco dinners, music festivals, beach days, and summer weddings, a straw bag in the mix is the ultimate finishing touch for peak summer vibes. Whether raffia, straw, or woven leather, these accessories instantly bring that laidback, vacation-ready energy to any outfit.From oversized straw totes and raffia crossbodies to woven leather basket bags and mini rattan clutches, there’s a shape, size, and texture for every summer scenario. (Though, we’ll always have a soft spot for a do-it-all style that goes from beach to bar and beyond.)Ahead, browse our favorite woven creations — ready to carry you through every sunny adventure this season.  DashDividers_1_500x100 Straw & Woven Tote Bags For picnics, farmers market runs, and vacations, a straw tote bag is your summer MVP. The easy, oversized silhouette fits all the essentials (plus every knick-knack you pick up along the ways) and easily doubles as a beach bag — or even a work bag, depending on the day. DashDividers_1_500x100 Straw & Woven Crossbody Bags Go hands-free with a crossbody bag for running errands, long walks, or dancing at concerts. Look for structured shapes or cinched bucket silhouettes with leather trims for added durability — and versatility to wear them to dressier events, too. DashDividers_1_500x100 Straw & Woven Basket Bags Throw on a milkmaid dress, slip into ballet flats, tie your hair back with a ribbon, and grab a basket bag to live your best “tomato girl summer.” This mid-size silhouette strikes the right balance — just roomy enough for daytime essentials, yet polished enough for cocktail-hour RSVPs. DashDividers_1_500x100 Straw & Woven Shoulder Bags Whether you’re drawn to a slouchy raffia hobo or a cylindrical baguette, shoulder bags bring a fresh twist to everyday styling. Think braided straps, sculptural hardware, and leather accents that make these feel a step above your standard summer carryall. DashDividers_1_500x100 Straw & Woven Mini Bags Small in size, big on charm. These mini straw styles — from dainty top handles to playful clutches — are made for weddings, date nights, and everything in between. Bonus points for shell shapes or nautical details that nod to a sunkissed fisherman aesthetic. Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?Raffia & Straw Accessories To Get Vacation ReadyNostalgic Plushie Bag Charms & Labubu Are TrendingInside Our Summer Carts: Editor Fashion Must-Haves
author: Emily Ruane

title: I Used To Have Piercings: How The Skims Pierced Nipple Bra Compares To The Real Thing
description: There’s a new nipple bra in town — and this time, it’s pierced. Following the release (and multiple restocks) of the popular Skims Nipple Push-Up Bra, the intimates brand dropped the Ultimate Pierced Nipple Bra in May. For the upgraded style, Skims added removable nylon-coated jewelry to the raised nipple-like design for what the brand calls an “unforgettable statement.” Naturally, the internet is losing it. No matter how you feel about the Kardashians, Kim K has mastered the art of virality, and when I saw this bra making the rounds online, I had to try it for myself. As a former pierced nipple girl myself — summer 2013, baby — I was intrigued. When I had the piercings, I loved the look of the body jewelry… until the reality set in. It hurt like hell. The healing process took forever. The jewelry got caught on everything. Eventually, one piercing vanished into the abyss as a result of a tragic bra mishap, and I rocked the solo look for a few years before retiring that one, too. Turns out, eternally hard nipples are less fun when they hurt as much as they did. Still, I’ve always had a soft spot for the look.  So when Kim said it was time to bring nipple piercings back (no needles required), I wondered: Could this bra recreate the look (and dare I say, energy) of a real piercing — without the pain, the healing time, or the risk of it getting snagged on a towel? I set out to find out. Skims Pierced Nipple Bra First Impressions I ordered the bra in the color Sienna. From the image online, I expected a lighter sand tone, but in person, it’s a richer shade that better matches my skin tone. The fabric is ultra-soft, with heavy padding and an underwire for a lifting effect. This is not your everyday bra; this is an occasion bra. A “my ex might be at this party” bra, if you will. The raised nipple detail looks surprisingly real, and the piercings — made from a hard plastic that matches the color of the fabric — are realistic enough to fool people.  The Fit This bra fits true to size — I am a 36C —  but packs a serious push-up punch. My boobs looked and felt at least one cup size larger. When I FaceTimed a friend, their first reaction was: “Wait… you look different.” After the big reveal, they were shocked at how authentic it looked. The bra also has thicker straps, which I appreciate for the added support and comfort. Styling It The Ultimate Pierced Nipple Bra gives “low effort, high impact,” so I’d let it do the talking. Wear it with a sheer or white tank, jeans, a minimal shoe, and maybe a red lip if you’re feeling bold. When the bra is the star, the outfit’s other elements can play backup dancers.  While I was only wearing a white tank and jean shorts, I felt…hot. Maybe it was the placebo effect, but while walking to my neighborhood bodega wearing this bra, I felt like all eyes were on me. With my real piercings, you could only see them if I wasn’t wearing a bra. Now that I’m in my 30s, my boobs just aren’t as perky as they used to be, but, with this bra, I get that extra va-va-voom. Final Thoughts Will I wear this bra again? To be honest, I don’t often wear a bra at all, but when I do, it’s more likely to be a soft, unlined bralette rather than a padded push-up. But this bra was…fun. It made me feel sexy, a little mischievous, and powerful. It’s not going to become my everyday go-to, but I did feel a bit more confident when I wore it — and maybe that’s the point. One note: Before wearing this, secure the balls at the end of the bars. Not realizing that they were removable, I didn’t check and, after just one wear, one of the balls went missing. I have since recovered it, but I’m not sure if the entire bar will fall out if you go without it being secure, leaving you, like me back in the day, with one single pierced nipple.  DashDividers_1_500x100 Is the Skims Pierced Nipple Bra an “unforgettable statement”? I guess that depends on who’s looking. Is it empowering and cheeky? Sure. Would I wear it again? Under the right circumstances — absolutely. Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?
author: Cortni Spearman

title: Skintight leggings or baggy joggers? What your gymwear says about you – and the world
description: Social media will tell you that all millennials dress one way to work out, while gen Z dresses another. The truth is more complex and far more interestingAround me, a group of women in skintight gym sets are side planking. Some are wearing full-coverage unitards, others leave slices of midriff bare. No one is wearing a baggy T-shirt from 2008 with a naked Rufus Wainwright on it, and hardened flecks of damp-proof paint. Except me.If TikTok is to be believed, my gym-mates must be millennials, born between the early 1980s and the mid-1990s; gen Z would find such skin-tightness a bit retro, or basic, or even “jurassic fitness”. Another generational schism has opened online – to add to socks, jeans and boundaries – this time over what millennials and gen Z are wearing to work out in. Tight-on-tight outfits supposedly single you out as a millennial – it is “giving middle school”, said one gen Z user witheringly – while gen Z prefers something baggier. Looking around me at pilates and in the park, though, I suspect some of the women wearing a second, seal-like skin are younger than 30. And here I am, days after turning 40 – squarely a millennial – wearing an enormous T-shirt. It is a muddled picture. Continue reading...
author: Ellie Violet Bramley

title: Rodeo drive: Beyoncé UK tour spurs cowboy fashion craze
description: Singer’s western-inspired Cowboy Carter tour is reminder of pop culture’s sway over shopping behaviourRhinestones, cowboy hats and a whole lot of denim; not a hen party entourage, a Glastonbury fit or a Nashville rodeo, but the queues outside Tottenham Hotspur Stadium this week, as Beyoncé kicked off her UK tour. And, seemingly, a new national dress code.Since the release of the Cowboy Carter album, Beyoncé fans have been quick to adopt the rancher style, sparking a surge in interest for western-inspired fashion. On Vinted, searches for “western” are up by 16% year on year this month, with “rodeo” up 13%. Meanwhile, denim searches have risen 8%. Continue reading...
author: Mabel Banfield-Nwachi
